events.title: Discovery of the Tomb of Tutankhamun
events.description: British archaeologist Howard Carter and his team unearthed the entrance to the tomb of the Egyptian Pharaoh Tutankhamun in the Valley of the Kings, one of the most significant archaeological discoveries of the 20th century.
events.significance: Offered unprecedented insights into Ancient Egyptian culture and funerary practices, and sparked widespread public interest in Egyptology.

events.title: Stalingrad: Soviet Counteroffensive Begins
events.description: The Soviet Red Army launched Operation Uranus, a major counteroffensive during the Battle of Stalingrad in World War II, encircling the German 6th Army.
events.significance: Marked a turning point on the Eastern Front, leading to the eventual defeat of Nazi Germany, and shifted the momentum in favor of the Allies.

events.title: Mumbai Terror Attacks End
events.description: The coordinated terrorist attacks in Mumbai, India that began on November 26 concluded after three days, resulting in the deaths of over 170 people.
events.significance: Highlighted global terrorism threats, led to enhanced counter-terrorism measures in India, and impacted international security policies.

events.title: Traditionally Marked Purchase of Manhattan Island
events.description: Peter Minuit, director of the Dutch colony of New Netherland, traditionally is recorded as having purchased Manhattan Island from Native Americans for goods worth 60 guilders.
events.significance: Symbolic beginning of European settlement in what became New York City, pivotal for the development of colonial America.
